After o
r
hartie C
o
mendac
o
ns: Whereas
her Ma
tie
for the better satisfacc
o
n of
the Burgesses and Inhabitauntes of the towne of
Ostend
hath resolved to revoke
S
r
John Conwaie
Knight and to place in his steed
S
r
Edward Norreis
beinge
a gentleman of good discrec
o
n valour and experrience, and one that is well
thought of by the said Inhabitauntes; We have thought good to require yo
u
to signify to the
Estates generall
and
Counsell of Estate
, the espetiall choyce
her Ma
tie
hath made of this gen
t
, her Highnes S
r
vaunt beinge well knowen unto
them, whome also for that purpose her Ma
tie
hath specially c
o
mended to the
States generall to be by their C
o
mission appointed governo
r
there and whome
alsoe she doubteth not but that he will Carry him selfe to their lykinge and
Contentm
t
, in the discharge of the truth c
o
mitted to him both for the safe
keepinge and good governem
t
of the towne: For w
ch
respect yo
u
shall deale
w
th
them both for the grauntinge his patent in good and ample forme and
for his entertaignem
t
and alloweaunce to make yt as Large as yo
u
can procure
yt, wherby he shall both have better authoritie and the better meanes,
discharge the Care and trust of the place c
o
mitted unto him: Wherein
prayinge yo
u
to afford him yo
r
best assystaunce and helpe,
we byd yo
u
hartely farewell: From the Court of
Otelands
the 11
th
of August

r
